Case 1:25-cv-22896-KMW Document 131 Entered on FLSD Docket 08/21/2025 Page 1 of 82

evidence.source_document: Motion to Stay Preliminary Injunction Pending Appeal and for Administrative Stay
evidence.text: The case is in the preliminary injunction phase, not a settlement phase. The case involves a preliminary injunction, not a settlement agreement, so there are no disputes over settlement enforcement.

According to the Complaint, on June 23, 2025, the Florida Division of Emergency Management ("FDEM") took control of the Dade-Collier Training and Transition Airport ("TNT"), in order to construct a mass migrant detention and deportation camp. (DE 1 ¶¶ 1, 39). Two days later, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis announced that the detention center was requested and would be fully funded by the federal government. (Id. ¶ 35). Pre-construction and construction activities at TNT began that week, (Id. ¶¶ 40–42), according to Plaintiffs, without any environmental assessment or impact statement having been prepared. (Id. ¶ 43).

extracted.value: Construction of a mass migrant detention and deportation camp at the Dade-Collier Training and Transition Airport (TNT) without environmental review under NEPA, causing environmental harms to the Everglades ecosystem

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief Relief Introduction

Clerks Notice of Judge Assignment to Judge Jose E. Martinez. Pursuant to 28 USC 636(c), the parties are hereby notified that the U.S. Magistrate Judge Eduardo I. Sanchez is available to handle any or all proceedings in this case.
No later than sixty (60) days from the date of this order

Plaintiffs Friends of the Everglades, Inc. ("Friends") and Center for Biological Diversity's ("CBD") (together, "Plaintiffs") Expedited Motion for Preliminary Injunction (DE 5) ("Motion for Preliminary Injunction").

extracted.value: Motion for Preliminary Injunction (DE 5): Filed by Plaintiffs to enjoin the State and Federal Defendants from developing or using the TNT site until NEPA compliance

evidence.text: Plaintiffs filed a Renewed Motion for TRO, explaining that since they filed suit, the "State and Federal Defendants commenced transporting immigration detainees to the TNT [s]ite,"

extracted.value: Renewed Motion for TRO (DE 40): Filed by Plaintiffs to halt further construction and transport of detainees to the TNT site

evidence.text: Plaintiffs Friends of the Everglades, Inc. ("Friends") and Center for Biological Diversity's ("CBD") (together, "Plaintiffs") Expedited Motion for Preliminary Injunction (DE 5) ("Motion for Preliminary Injunction"). ... Plaintiffs request that the Court enjoin the State and Federal Defendants from developing or using the TNT site as an immigration detention camp "unless and until Defendants comply with NEPA and the APA."

extracted.value: Preliminary injunction to halt construction and operation of the detention camp until NEPA compliance

evidence.text: prohibiting the State and Federal Defendants and their officers, agents, employees, attorneys, and any person who is in active concert or participation with them from (1) installing any additional industrial-style lighting (described by witnesses as "Sunbelt" lighting); or doing any paving, filling, excavating, or fencing; or doing any other site expansion, including placing or erecting any additional buildings, tents, dormitories, or other residential or administrative facilities on the TNT site

extracted.value: Prohibition on additional industrial-style lighting, paving, filling, excavating, or fencing

evidence.text: and (2) bringing any additional persons onto the TNT site who were not already being detained at the site at the time of this Order going into effect.

extracted.value: Prohibition on bringing additional detainees to the site
